rules.natural: If the Tablet electronic device is blacklisted, then the Artwork does not violate the CopyrightPolicy condition.
Either the Tablet electronic device is blacklisted or the Tablet electronic device is suspended.
Provided that the DigitalPiece artwork has publication pending, then if the Tablet electronic device is suspended, the Artwork does not violate the CopyrightPolicy condition.
If the DigitalPiece artwork is under review, then the DigitalPiece artwork has publication pending.

Should a network audit be initiated for the GalleryNetwork, then if it is not the case that the DigitalGallery not being operational implies the DigitalPiece artwork is not authenticated, then the DigitalPiece artwork publication is not rejected.
Either a network audit is initiated for the GalleryNetwork or a security scan is triggered for the GalleryNetwork.

If a security scan is triggered for the GalleryNetwork, then under the condition that it is not true that the DigitalGallery not being operational leads to the DigitalPiece artwork not being authenticated, the DigitalPiece artwork publication is not rejected.

If Curator override is enabled for the DigitalPiece, then provided that it is not the case that the DigitalGallery not being operational results in the Curator not approving the DigitalPiece artwork, the DigitalPiece artwork is archived.
If the Admin authorizes the Tablet electronic device, then the Curator approves the DigitalPiece for publication.

If Admin override is enabled for the DigitalPiece, then given that it is not true that the DigitalGallery not being operational implies the Curator does not approve the DigitalPiece artwork, the DigitalPiece artwork is archived.
If a legal penalty is issued by the CopyrightAgency, then a legal investigation is not opened by the CopyrightAgency.

rules.prover9_expression: (device_registered(Tablet, GalleryNetwork) -> (-(-(publication_approved(Curator, DigitalPiece) -> (-gallery_operational(DigitalGallery) -> -artwork_approved(Curator, DigitalPiece))) -> condition_met(Artwork, ExhibitionStandards)) -> device_updated(Tablet, Firmware)))
rules.natural: If the Tablet electronic device is registered on the GalleryNetwork, then provided that it is not the case that the Curator not approving the DigitalPiece for publication with the DigitalGallery not being operational implying the Curator does not approve the DigitalPiece artwork leads to the Artwork meeting the ExhibitionStandards condition, then the Tablet electronic device receives a firmware update.
If neither Curator override nor Admin override is enabled for the DigitalPiece, then manual review is required for the DigitalPiece artwork.

If it is not the case that a system alert raised by the SecuritySystem results in the Admin not authorizing the Tablet electronic device with the DigitalGallery not being operational implying the Curator does not approve the DigitalPiece artwork leading to authorization being bypassed by the Admin, then a legal investigation is opened by the CopyrightAgency.

Provided that a system alert raised by the SecuritySystem does not lead to the Admin not authorizing the Tablet electronic device with the DigitalGallery not being operational implying the Curator does not approve the DigitalPiece artwork resulting in authorization being bypassed by the Admin, then a legal penalty is issued by the CopyrightAgency.

Should the Curator approving the DigitalPiece for publication not result in the DigitalGallery not being operational implying the Curator does not approve the DigitalPiece artwork, then the Artwork does not meet the ExhibitionStandards condition.

Provided that it is not true that the DigitalGallery not being operational implying the Artist does not submit the DigitalPiece artwork results in the DigitalPiece artwork not being granted publication in the ExhibitionCatalog, then the Artwork violates the CopyrightPolicy condition.
Should the DigitalGallery not being operational not imply the Curator does not approve the DigitalPiece artwork, then the DigitalPiece artwork is not archived.
If the DigitalGallery not being operational does not result in the DigitalPiece artwork not being authenticated, then the DigitalPiece artwork publication is rejected.
If the DigitalGallery not being operational does not imply the Artist does not submit the DigitalPiece artwork, then the DigitalPiece artwork is granted publication in the ExhibitionCatalog.
If the DigitalGallery is not operational, then the Curator approves the DigitalPiece artwork.
When the DigitalGallery is not operational, then the DigitalPiece artwork is authenticated.
Provided that the DigitalGallery is not operational, then the Artist submits the DigitalPiece artwork.
